definition: to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: However, some people criticized the Objectivists and their followers.
sentences.chinese: 然而，有些人批评的客观主义及其追随者。

sentences.english: Objectivism is about the importance of the individual and reasonable thought.
sentences.chinese: 客观主义是关于个人和理性思考的重要性。

sentences.english: Richard Rorty is a gravedigger of the objectivism tradition of the western philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 罗蒂是西方哲学客观主义传统的掘墓人。

sentences.english: It is different from objectivism's method on categorization of our experience.
sentences.chinese: 它在经验的范畴化方法上区别于客观主义。

sentences.english: Ayn Rand said that "Atlas Shrugged" fully defined her philosophy of Objectivism.
sentences.chinese: 安兰德说，“地球颤栗”完全确定她的客观主义哲学。

sentences.english: The author favors in adopts one relatively objectivism the standpoint.
sentences.chinese: 笔者更倾向于采取一种相对客观主义的立场。

definition: epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
theory of reflection (in dialectic materialism), i.e. every perception reflects physical reality

pinyin: Fa3 lan2 ke4 fu2 Xue2 pai4

definition: voluntarism/metaphysical view, esp. due to Schopenhauer 叔本華|叔本华[Shu1 ben3 hua2], that the essence of the world is willpower
